org.ojalgo.optimisation.linear
Class LinearSolver

java.lang.Object
  org.ojalgo.optimisation.GenericSolver
      org.ojalgo.optimisation.BaseSolver
          org.ojalgo.optimisation.linear.LinearSolver
All Implemented Interfaces:
Optimisation, Optimisation.Solver
public abstract class LinearSolver
extends BaseSolver

LinearSolver solves optimisation problems of the (LP standard) form:

min [C]T[X]
when [AE][X] == [BE]
and 0 <= [X]
and 0 <= [BE]

A Linear Program is in Standard Form if:
  • All constraints are equality constraints.
  • All variables have a nonnegativity sign restriction.

Further it is required here that the constraint right hand sides are nonnegative (nonnegative elements in [BE]).

You construct instances by using the LinearSolver.Builder class. It will return an appropriate subclass for you. It's recommended that you first create a ExpressionsBasedModel and feed that to the LinearSolver.Builder. Alternatively you can directly call ExpressionsBasedModel.getDefaultSolver() or even ExpressionsBasedModel.minimise() or ExpressionsBasedModel.maximise() on the model.

http://www.cise.ufl.edu/~davis/Morgan/chapter2.htm

Author:
apete
